content.rendered:
Fascinating Sri Lanka Tour Package

Home » International » Sri Lanka » Fascinating Sri Lanka Tour Package

Tour Overview

The island country of Sri Lanka is one of the most charming holiday destinations in the world. Adorned with numerous picturesque holiday spots and holy sites of pilgrimage, Sri Lanka has always attracted a throng of travelers from far and wide. A fascinating Sri Lanka tour package will provide you with a memorable journey across some of the most highly acclaimed tourist destinations in this treasure trove of island. For 4 days and 3 nights stay engulfed in and unparalleled unique vibrancy.

Fascinating Sri Lanka Tour Itinerary Package

Day 1 :Arrival in Colombo – Kandy

Upon arriving at the Colombo international airport our tour representative will escort you to the vehicle that will transfer you to Kandy after covering a distance of 3 hours.

En route you will be made to stop at Pinnawala elephant orphanage which will be your very first location for visit. It is home to orphaned, injured and abandoned elephants where the volunteers and caretakers take care of them. You will be given an opportunity to play around and bathe with these gentle giants.

Your journey will then continue towards the wonderful destination of Kandy, which is at a distance of 1 hour 30 minutes from the elephant orphanage. Upon arriving at Kandy you will be taken on a citywide sightseeing tour which will cover the following sites: Sri Dalada Maligawa (temple of the tooth) – an iconic temple which houses Lord Buddha’s tooth relic; royal botanical gardens Peradeniya – an exuberant presentation of numerous colorful flowers and plants; gem museum – home to the finest quality of precious and semi-precious gemstones in the world.

In the evening you will be made to witness a traditional Sri Lankan cultural dance show (entry fees will not be included). After a wholesome day you will be taken to your hotel in Kandy for an overnight stay.

Day 2 :Kandy – Nuwara Eliya

After having a delicious breakfast in the morning, you will be transferred to the ‘city of lights’, Nuwara Eliya. Also known as ‘little England’ a city wide sightseeing tour will commence upon your arrival. You will be covering the following tourist attractions of the city: golf course; trout stream; Victoria park – home to a number of rare birds and lush greenery; Lake Gregory – for fishing and boating; tea factory – which produces some of the world’s finest quality of tea, orange pekoe tea.

You will also be made to visit the holy site of Seetha Amman temple – the site where Sita was held captive by Ravana and where she used to pray for Rama to rescue her, as mentioned in the Hindu epic, Ramayana. It also houses a footprint of Lord Hanuman on a rock; Hakgala garden – a temperate garden with numerous water lilies and peaceful serenity.

Finally, you will be taken to your allotted hotel for an overnight stay.

Day 3 :Nuwara Eliya – Colombo

After having a delicious breakfast in the morning you will be transferred to Colombo (the largest city and the commercial capital of Sri Lanka) which is situated at a distance of 5 hours from Nuwara Eliya.

The sightseeing tour of this western coastal city of Sri Lanka will cover the following attractions: Galle face green – a 500 metres long ocean side urban park; Viharamahadevi Park – oldest and the largest public park; National Museum – the largest museum in Sri Lanka; Colombo world trade centre – 500 feet tall, 39 storied twin building; old parliament building and independence square (the entry fees to these places will not be included by us).

You will then be taken to some of the prime shopping locations of Odel, house of fashion, Beverley Street, majestic city and Noritake.

Finally, after a day filled with exciting fun activities, you will be made to head back to your hotel for an overnight stay.

Day 4 :Colombo Departure

Post breakfast, you will be made to proceed towards the international airport where you will be made to board the flight heading towards your desired destination.

Price Details

Tour Name Fascinating Sri Lanka Tour Package
Duration 4 Days / 3 Nights
Destinations Colombo - Kandy - Nuwara Eliya
Tour Price On Request

    Holiday Your Way with Namaste India Trip!

    Filling out the information form provided allows you to receive the best budget-friendly customized itinerary in just a few hours.

    • We assure the privacy of your contact data.

    • This data will only be used by our team to contact you and no other purposes.

    Trip Highlights

    • Visit the famous Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage
    • Kandy city sightseeing
    • Witness the Sri Lankan culture dance performance
    • Be a part of the city of lights, Nuwara Eliya
    • Pay your respect at the divine shrine of Sita Amman temple, here Devi Sita was captivated by Ravana.
    • Colombo sightseeing
    • Taste the local cuisine

    Package Inclusions

    • All car / taxi / cab service
    • Accommodation as per itinerary
    • Meals as per itinerary
    • Driver allowance, parking fees, fuel charges
    • Pick up and drop off service

    Package Exclusions

    • Medical and travel insurance
    • Any expense of personal nature
    • Monument entrance fees
    • Tipping, phone bills, etc.
    • Anything not mentioned in the inclusions section

    FAQs for Sri Lanka Package

    Q. What Makes Sri Lanka So Lovely?

    A. Sri Lanka is stunning not only for its stunning beaches and rolling, picture-perfect tea hills. Sri Lanka is beautiful not only because of the exotic wildlife that roams much of the island. Sri Lanka is stunning not only because of its breathtaking waterfalls and temples.

    Q. Why Are Tourists Drawn To Sri Lanka?

    A. Sri Lanka's tropical climate, beautiful beaches, and incredible food are just a few of the many reasons to put the South Asian country on your travel bucket list.

    Q. What Type Of Stone Is Famous In Sri Lanka?

    A. Sri Lanka, formerly Ceylon, continues to be one of the most important sources of fine gemstones. Blue sapphire, pink sapphire or ruby, and yellow sapphire stand out, as do alexandrite and cat's-eye Chrysoberyl, and almandine and hessonite garnet.

    Q. When Is The Best Time Of Year To Visit Sri Lanka?

    A. The best time to visit the west and south coasts, as well as the Cultural Triangle, is between December and April, while the east coast has the best weather from May to October.

    Q. What Distinguishes Sri Lanka From India?

    A. One of the most significant geographical distinctions is that Sri Lanka is an island, whereas India is not. Sri Lanka is known as the Pearl of the Indian Ocean. Sri Lanka, like a pearl glistening in the sunlight, outshines India in so many ways. Despite its size, the island is much smaller than India.
